alert.note: Alert for Aurora; Bon Homme; Brule; Charles Mix; Davison; Douglas; Gregory; Hanson; Hutchinson; Jerauld; Sanborn (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 20 at 1:53PM MST until December 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM WEDNESDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 2 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph Thursday and Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southeast South Dakota. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM Wednesday to noon CST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Those with holiday travel plans will want to monitor the forecast closely and adjust plans as necessary. Any person that becomes stranded or trapped outdoors could encounter a life-threatening situation in a short amount of time.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
